00037 /**
00038  * @def SendMsg
00039  * @brief Data request to the next lower layer.
00040  *
00041  * This function calls the next lower layer to request a data transmission.
00042  *
00043  */
00044 #define SendMsg PDSap
00045 
00046 /** @brief Structure type for all layer configuration settings
00047  *
00048  * To be IEEE layer complient, all configuration data is stored
00049  * in one data structure.
00050  */
00051 typedef struct
00052 {
00053     AddrT    src;  /**< MAC address of this device */
00054     AddrT    dest; /**< MAC address of the peer device */
00055     bool_t  fast_ranging; /** true == fast ranging is enabled */
00056 } AplMemT;
00057 
00058 /** @brief Memory for all layer configuration settings.  */
00059 AplMemT aplM;
00060 /** @brief Pointer to memory for all layer configuration settings.  */
00061 AplMemT *apl;
00062 /** @brief Message structure for data or ranging requests.  */
00063 MsgT downMsg;
00064 /** @brief Message structure for payload of received ranging packets.  */
00065 RangingMsgT *upRangingMsg;
00066 /** @brief Ranging type which is used */
00067 uint8_t ranging_type = RANGING_TYPE_3W_A;
00068 uint32_t last_calib = 0;
00069 
00070 bool_t Permission(uint8_t *macAddr, uint8_t *data, uint8_t *len);
00071 void *GetMemForPHY(uint16_t memSize, uint8_t *macAddr);

00077 #ifdef CONFIG_ALIVE_LED
00078 #include "led.h"
00079 /**
00080  * @brief Periodicaly flash one LED.
00081  *
00082  * Hartbeat to indicate a normal running application
00083  */
00084 /****************************************************************************/
00085 void IsAlive (void)
00086 /****************************************************************************/
00087 {
00088     static  int flag = 0;
00089     static  unsigned long   last = 0;
00090     unsigned long   now;
00091 
00092     now = hwclock();
00093     if(now - last > 500)
00094     {
00095         last = now;
00096         if(flag == 0)
00097         {
00098             flag = 1;
00099             LED_ALIVE (LED_ON);
00100         }
00101         else
00102         {
00103             flag = 0;
00104             LED_ALIVE (LED_OFF);
00105         }
00106     }
00107 }
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 /*******************************************************************/
00111 /**
00112  * @brief Upstream message handling.
00113  * @par payload containing data
00114  * @par len length of payload
00115  *
00116  * ApplCallback represents the upstream part of the application.
00117  *
00118  */
00119 void APLCallback (MsgT *msg)
00120 {
00121 
00122     char serial_print_buffer[32];
00123 
00124     switch (msg->prim)
00125     {
00126         case PD_DATA_INDICATION:
00127             /* TODO DEBUG REMOVE */
00128             printf("APLCallback: ");
00129             uint8_t o;
00130             for (o=0; o<msg->len; o++)
00131             {
00132                 printf("0x%X ", msg->data[o]);
00133             }
00134             printf("\n");
00135             break;
00136         case PD_DATA_CONFIRM: break;
00137         case PD_RANGING_CONFIRM:
00138             upRangingMsg = (RangingMsgT*) msg->data;
00139             switch(msg->status)
00140             {
00141                 case PHY_SUCCESS    :
00142                     /* hwack received, ranging start successfully */
00143                     break;
00144                 case PHY_NO_ACK     :
00145                     /* no hwack received, ranging didnt start */
00146                     sprintf(serial_print_buffer,"#%07.2f:%03i:0x%02X\n",upRangingMsg->distance,msg->addr[0],upRangingMsg->error);
00147 
00148                     printf("%s",serial_print_buffer);
00149 
00150                     break;
00151                 case PHY_BUSY       :
00152                 case PHY_BUSY_TX    :
00153                     /* measurement is allready running (BUSY), wait
00154                         for PD_RANGING_INDICATION first! */
00155                     break;
00156                 case PHY_CONFIGURATION_ERROR :
00157                     /* driver isnt correct initialized for ranging */
00158                     sprintf(serial_print_buffer,"#%07.2f:%03i:0x%02X\n",upRangingMsg->distance,msg->addr[0],upRangingMsg->error);
00159 
00160                     printf("%s",serial_print_buffer);
00161                     break;
00162                 default : break;
00163             }
00164             break;
00165         case PD_RANGING_INDICATION:
00166             LED0 (LED_OFF);
00167             upRangingMsg = (RangingMsgT*) msg->data;
00168 
00169             sprintf(serial_print_buffer,"#%07.2f:%03i:0x%02X\n",upRangingMsg->distance,msg->addr[0],upRangingMsg->error);
00170 
00171             printf("%s",serial_print_buffer);
00172             break;
00173         default: break;
00174     }
00175 
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*******************************************************************/
00179 /**
00180  * @brief Poll function of the application.
00181  *
00182  * Will be called from the system main loop in frequent intervals.
00183 */
00184 void    APLPoll(void)
00185 {
00186 #ifndef TIMER_LIB
00187     uint32_t now = hwclock();
00188     static uint32_t last = 0;
00189 #endif
00190 
00191 
00192 #ifdef TIMER_LIB
00193     TimerPoll();
00194 #endif
00195 
00196     /* check key 2, if its pressed => wait until released and
00197         after that toggle the ranging type beween all 3 possible
00198         types */
00199     if (GetKeyState(1) == KEY_REL_AFTER_10MS)
00200     {
00201         if (ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP) ranging_type = RANGING_TYPE_3W_A;
00202         else if (ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_3W_A) ranging_type = RANGING_TYPE_3W_B;
00203         else if (ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_3W_B) ranging_type = RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP;
00204         printf("RangingType : %s\n", ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP ? "2W_PP" :
00205                                      ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_3W_A ? "3W_A" :
00206                                      ranging_type == RANGING_TYPE_3W_B ? "3W_B" : "ERROR");
00207 
00208 #ifdef TIMER_LIB
00209         TimerCancel(t_recal);
00210 
00211         t_recal = TimerStart(   5000, /*[ms]*/
00212                     &TimerRecal, /*callback function*/
00213                     NULL); /* parameter */
00214 
00215         printf("RecalTimer restarted\n");
00216 #endif
00217     }
00218 
00219 #ifndef TIMER_LIB
00220     /* send ranging every 125ms */
00221     if(now > last + 125)
00222     {
00223         {   /* recalibration every 5sec */
00224             if (now > last_calib + 5000)
00225             {
00226                 downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00227                 downMsg.attribute = PHY_RECALIBRATION;
00228                 PLMESap (&downMsg);
00229                 last_calib = now;
00230             }
00231         }
00232 
00233         /* store last timestamp */
00234         last = now;
00235 
00236         memcpy (downMsg.addr, apl->dest, sizeof(AddrT));
00237         downMsg.prim = PD_RANGING_REQUEST;
00238 
00239 #ifdef SIMULATE_USER_DATA
00240         /* dummy userdata only for demonstration */
00241         downMsg.data[0] = 0x11;
00242         downMsg.data[1] = 0x12;
00243         downMsg.data[2] = 0x13;
00244         downMsg.data[3] = 0x14;
00245         downMsg.data[4] = 0x22;
00246         downMsg.data[5] = 0x32;
00247         downMsg.data[6] = 0x42;
00248         downMsg.data[7] = 0x52;
00249         /* dummy data length */
00250         downMsg.len = 8;
00251 #else
00252         downMsg.len = 0;
00253 #endif
00254 
00255         downMsg.attribute = ranging_type;
00256         if( ranging_type != RANGING_TYPE_3W_B )
00257         {
00258             LED0 (LED_ON);
00259         }
00260         SendMsg (&downMsg);
00261     }
00262 #endif /* TIMER_LIB */
00263 
00264 
00265 #ifdef CONFIG_ALIVE_LED
00266     IsAlive();
00267 #endif
00268 
00269 }
00270 
00271 /****************************************************************************/
00272 void *phyMemP = NULL;
00273 void *GetMemForPHY(uint16_t memSize, uint8_t *macAddr)
00274 {
00275     static uint8_t first = 1;
00276 
00277     if (phyMemP == NULL)
00278     {
00279         phyMemP = malloc(memSize);
00280     }
00281 
00282     if (first) memset(phyMemP, 0, memSize);
00283     first = 0;
00284 
00285     return phyMemP;
00286 }
00287 
00288 /****************************************************************************/
00289 bool_t Permission(uint8_t *macAddr, uint8_t *data, uint8_t *len)
00290 {
00291 #ifdef SIMULATE_USER_DATA
00292     uint8_t return_data[] = {0xAA, 0xBB, 0xCC, 0xDD, 0xEE};
00293 
00294     *len = 5;
00295     memcpy(data, return_data, *len);
00296 #endif
00297     return TRUE;
00298 }
00299 
00300 #ifdef TIMER_LIB
00301 /*******************************************************************/
00302 void TimerRecal(void *param)
00303 {
00304     static uint32_t last = 0;
00305 
00306     t_recal = TimerStart(   5000, /*[ms]*/
00307                 &TimerRecal, /*callback function*/
00308                 NULL); /* parameter */
00309 
00310     uint32_t now = hwclock();
00311     printf("(%ld) TimerRecal : %ld\n", now, now - last);
00312     last = now;
00313 
00314     do
00315     {
00316         PHYPoll();
00317 
00318         if (PHYIsIDLE())
00319         {
00320             downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00321             downMsg.attribute = PHY_RECALIBRATION;
00322             PLMESap (&downMsg);
00323         }
00324 
00325     }while(!PHYIsIDLE());
00326 }
00327 
00328 /*******************************************************************/
00329 void TimerRanging(void *param)
00330 {
00331     static uint32_t last = 0;
00332 
00333     TimerStart( 125, /*[ms]*/
00334                 &TimerRanging, /*callback function*/
00335                 NULL); /* parameter */
00336 
00337     uint32_t now = hwclock();
00338     printf("(%ld) TimerRanging : %ld\n", now, now - last);
00339     last = now;
00340 
00341     memcpy (downMsg.addr, apl->dest, sizeof(AddrT));
00342     downMsg.prim = PD_RANGING_REQUEST;
00343 
00344 #ifdef SIMULATE_USER_DATA
00345     /* dummy userdata only for demonstration */
00346     downMsg.data[0] = 0x11;
00347     downMsg.data[1] = 0x12;
00348     downMsg.data[2] = 0x13;
00349     downMsg.data[3] = 0x14;
00350     downMsg.data[4] = 0x22;
00351     downMsg.data[5] = 0x32;
00352     downMsg.data[6] = 0x42;
00353     downMsg.data[7] = 0x52;
00354     /* dummy data length */
00355     downMsg.len = 8;
00356 #else
00357     downMsg.len = 0;
00358 #endif
00359 
00360     downMsg.attribute = ranging_type;
00361     LED0 (LED_ON);
00362     SendMsg (&downMsg);
00363 }
00364 #endif
00365 
00366 /*******************************************************************/
00367 /**
00368  * @brief Initialize the application.
00369  *
00370  * Initialize the application.
00371 */
00372 void    APLInit(void)
00373 {
00374     apl = &aplM;
00375 
00376 /***************** ANCHOR CODE *****************/
00377     apl->src[0] = 0xF1;
00378     apl->src[1] = 0x00;
00379     apl->src[2] = 0x00;
00380     apl->src[3] = 0x00;
00381     apl->src[4] = 0x00;
00382     apl->src[5] = 0x00;
00383     /* write the source address to the TRX chip */
00384     downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00385     downMsg.attribute = PHY_MAC_ADDRESS1;
00386     memcpy (downMsg.data, apl->src, 6);
00387     PLMESap (&downMsg);
00388 
00389     /* switch FEC on */
00390     downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00391     downMsg.attribute = PHY_FEC;
00392     downMsg.value = FALSE;
00393     PLMESap (&downMsg);
00394 
00395     downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00396     downMsg.attribute = PHY_RX_CMD;
00397     downMsg.value = PHY_RX_ON;
00398     PLMESap (&downMsg);
00399 
00400     apl->fast_ranging = FALSE;
00401 
00402     NTRXAllCalibration();
00403 
00404 #ifdef TIMER_LIB
00405     printf("START_TIMER\n");
00406 
00407     TimerInitLib();
00408 
00409     TimerStart( 125, /*[ms]*/
00410                 &TimerRanging, /*callback function*/
00411                 NULL); /* parameter */
00412 
00413     t_recal = TimerStart(   5000, /*[ms]*/
00414                 &TimerRecal, /*callback function*/
00415                 NULL); /* parameter */
00416 #endif
00417 
00418     apl->dest[0] = 0xF2;
00419     apl->dest[1] = 0x00;
00420     apl->dest[2] = 0x00;
00421     apl->dest[3] = 0x00;
00422     apl->dest[4] = 0x00;
00423     apl->dest[5] = 0x00;
00424 
00425 
00426 #ifdef CSMA
00427     downMsg.prim = PLME_SET_REQUEST;
00428     downMsg.attribute = PHY_CCA_MODE;
00429     downMsg.value = PHY_CCA_MODE_1;
00430     PLMESap (&downMsg);
00431 #endif
00432 
00433     RangingRegisterCallback(&Permission, &GetMemForPHY);
00434 }
